div.p: Alt Title (Alternate Title in Bibliography searches in published text), a category in the Bibliography Database, is the not-as-common title that a work is known by, such as an earlier title later replaced, or the title of an American edition. It is used in conjunction with a REGTITLE in the bibl db record.

The Alternate Title field can also be used when entering translations by writers with entries. Use Alternate Title box to record the title before translation when. Elizabeth Inchbald's The Child of Nature is a translation of Zélie; ou, L'ingénue, so The Child of Nature is the main title of her work, and Zélie; ou, L'ingénue is its Alternate Title.
The Far-Away Bride (a short form of the title as published in the USA) is listed as the Alternate Title of Stella Benson’s Tobit Transplanted.
The Lacedemonian Mercury is the Alternate Title of a seventeenth-century periodical which switched to this title after being launched as The London Mercury.
